00082 /****************************************
00083  * exclusive startup                    *
00084  ****************************************/

00086 static struct __sem_s {
00087         char           *name;
00088         key_t           sem_key;
00089         int             sem_id;
00090 } sems[2] = {
00091         [GSSD_CLI] = { "client",  0x3a92d473, 0 },
00092         [GSSD_SVC] = { "server",  0x3b92d473, 0 },
00093 };
00094 
00095 void gssd_init_unique(int type)
00096 {
00097         struct __sem_s *sem = &sems[type];
00098         struct sembuf   sembuf;
00099 
00100         assert(type == GSSD_CLI || type == GSSD_SVC);
00101 
00102 again:
00103         sem->sem_id = semget(sem->sem_key, 1, IPC_CREAT | IPC_EXCL | 0700);
00104         if (sem->sem_id == -1) {
00105                 if (errno != EEXIST) {
00106                         printerr(0, "Create sem: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00107                         exit(-1);
00108                 }
00109 
00110                 /* already exist. Note there's still a small window racing
00111                  * with other processes, due to the stupid semaphore semantics.
00112                  */
00113                 sem->sem_id = semget(sem->sem_key, 0, 0700);
00114                 if (sem->sem_id == -1) {
00115                         if (errno == ENOENT) {
00116                                 printerr(0, "another instance just exit, "
00117                                          "try again\n");
00118                                 goto again;
00119                         }
00120 
00121                         printerr(0, "Obtain sem: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00122                         exit(-1);
00123                 }
00124         } else {
00125                 int val = 1;
00126 
00127                 if (semctl(sem->sem_id, 0, SETVAL, val) == -1) {
00128                         printerr(0, "Initialize sem: %s\n",
00129                                  strerror(errno));
00130                         exit(-1);
00131                 }
00132         }
00133 
00134         sembuf.sem_num = 0;
00135         sembuf.sem_op = -1;
00136         sembuf.sem_flg = IPC_NOWAIT | SEM_UNDO;
00137 
00138         if (semop(sem->sem_id, &sembuf, 1) != 0) {
00139                 if (errno == EAGAIN) {
00140                         printerr(0, "Another instance is running, exit\n");
00141                         exit(0);
00142                 }
00143                 printerr(0, "Grab sem: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00144                 exit(0);
00145         }
00146 
00147         printerr(2, "Successfully created %s global identity\n", sem->name);
00148 }
00149 
00150 void gssd_exit_unique(int type)
00151 {
00152         assert(type == GSSD_CLI || type == GSSD_SVC);
00153 
00154         /*
00155          * do nothing. we can't remove the sem here, otherwise the race
00156          * window would be much bigger. So it's sad we have to leave the
00157          * sem in the system forever.
00158          */
00159 }

00161 /****************************************
00162  * client side resolvation:             *
00163  *    lnd/netid/nid => hostname         *
00164  ****************************************/
00165 
00166 char gethostname_ex[PATH_MAX] = GSSD_DEFAULT_GETHOSTNAME_EX;
00167 
00168 typedef int lnd_nid2hostname_t(char *lnd, uint32_t net, uint32_t addr,
00169                                char *buf, int buflen);
00170 
00171 /* FIXME what about IPv6? */
00172 static
00173 int ipv4_nid2hostname(char *lnd, uint32_t net, uint32_t addr,
00174                       char *buf, int buflen)
00175 {
00176         struct hostent  *ent;
00177 
00178         addr = htonl(addr);
00179         ent = gethostbyaddr(&addr, sizeof(addr), AF_INET);
00180         if (!ent) {
00181                 printerr(0, "%s: can't resolve 0x%x\n", lnd, addr);
00182                 return -1;
00183         }
00184         if (strlen(ent->h_name) >= buflen) {
00185                 printerr(0, "%s: name too long: %s\n", lnd, ent->h_name);
00186                 return -1;
00187         }
00188         strcpy(buf, ent->h_name);
00189 
00190         printerr(2, "%s: net 0x%x, addr 0x%x => %s\n",
00191                  lnd, net, addr, buf);
00192         return 0;
00193 }
00194 
00195 static
00196 int lolnd_nid2hostname(char *lnd, uint32_t net, uint32_t addr,
00197                        char *buf, int buflen)
00198 {
00199         struct utsname   uts;
00200         struct hostent  *ent;
00201 
00202         if (addr) {
00203                 printerr(0, "%s: addr is 0x%x, we expect 0\n", lnd, addr);
00204                 return -1;
00205         }
00206 
00207         if (uname(&uts)) {
00208                 printerr(0, "%s: failed obtain local machine name\n", lnd);
00209                 return -1;
00210         }
00211 
00212         ent = gethostbyname(uts.nodename);
00213         if (!ent) {
00214                 printerr(0, "%s: failed obtain canonical name of %s\n",
00215                          lnd, uts.nodename);
00216                 return -1;
00217         }
00218 
00219         if (strlen(ent->h_name) >= buflen) {
00220                 printerr(0, "%s: name too long: %s\n", lnd, ent->h_name);
00221                 return -1;
00222         }
00223         strcpy(buf, ent->h_name);
00224 
00225         printerr(3, "%s: addr 0x%x => %s\n", lnd, addr, buf);
00226         return 0;
00227 }
00228 
00229 static int is_space(char c)
00230 {
00231         return (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n');
00232 }
00233 
00234 static
00235 int external_nid2hostname(char *lnd, uint32_t net, uint32_t addr,
00236                           char *namebuf, int namebuflen)
00237 {
00238         const int bufsize = PATH_MAX + 256;
00239         char buf[bufsize], *head, *tail;
00240         FILE *fghn;
00241 
00242         sprintf(buf, "%s %s 0x%x 0x%x", gethostname_ex, lnd, net, addr);
00243         printerr(2, "cmd: %s\n", buf);
00244 
00245         fghn = popen(buf, "r");
00246         if (fghn == NULL) {
00247                 printerr(0, "failed to call %s\n", gethostname_ex);
00248                 return -1;
00249         }
00250 
00251         head = fgets(buf, bufsize, fghn);
00252         if (head == NULL) {
00253                 printerr(0, "can't read from %s\n", gethostname_ex);
00254                 return -1;
00255         }
00256         if (pclose(fghn) == -1)
00257                 printerr(1, "pclose failed, continue\n");
00258 
00259         /* trim head/tail space */
00260         while (is_space(*head))
00261                 head++;
00262 
00263         tail = head + strlen(head);
00264         if (tail <= head) {
00265                 printerr(0, "no output from %s\n", gethostname_ex);
00266                 return -1;
00267         }
00268         while (is_space(*(tail - 1)))
00269                 tail--;
00270         if (tail <= head) {
00271                 printerr(0, "output are all space from %s\n", gethostname_ex);
00272                 return -1;
00273         }
00274         *tail = '\0';
00275 
00276         /* start with '@' means error msg */
00277         if (head[0] == '@') {
00278                 printerr(0, "error from %s: %s\n", gethostname_ex, &head[1]);
00279                 return -1;
00280         }
00281 
00282         if (tail - head > namebuflen) {
00283                 printerr(0, "external hostname too long: %s\n", head);
00284                 return -1;
00285         }
00286 
00287         printerr(2, "%s: net 0x%x, addr 0x%x => %s\n",
00288                  lnd, net, addr, head);
00289         strcpy(namebuf, head);
00290         return 0;
00291 }
00292 
00293 struct convert_struct {
00294         char                    *name;
00295         lnd_nid2hostname_t      *nid2name;
00296 };
00297 
00298 static struct convert_struct converter[] = {
00299         [0]             = { "UNUSED0",  NULL},
00300         [QSWLND]        = { "QSWLND",   external_nid2hostname},
00301         [SOCKLND]       = { "SOCKLND",  ipv4_nid2hostname },
00302         [GMLND]         = { "GMLND",    external_nid2hostname},
00303         [PTLLND]        = { "PTLLND",   external_nid2hostname },
00304         [O2IBLND]       = { "O2IBLND",  ipv4_nid2hostname },
00305         [LOLND]         = { "LOLND",    lolnd_nid2hostname },
00306         [RALND]         = { "RALND",    external_nid2hostname },
00307         [MXLND]         = { "MXLND",    external_nid2hostname },
00308 };
00309 
00310 #define LND_MAX         (sizeof(converter) / sizeof(converter[0]))
00311 
00312 int lnet_nid2hostname(lnet_nid_t nid, char *buf, int buflen)
00313 {
00314         uint32_t lnd, net, addr;
00315 
00316         addr = LNET_NIDADDR(nid);
00317         net = LNET_NIDNET(nid);
00318         lnd = LNET_NETTYP(net);
00319 
00320         if (lnd >= LND_MAX) {
00321                 printerr(0, "ERROR: Unrecognized LND %u\n", lnd);
00322                 return -1;
00323         }
00324 
00325         if (converter[lnd].nid2name == NULL) {
00326                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s converter not ready\n",
00327                         converter[lnd].name);
00328                 return -1;
00329         }
00330 
00331         return converter[lnd].nid2name(converter[lnd].name, net, addr,
00332                                        buf, buflen);
00333 }

00335 
00336 /****************************************
00337  * user mapping database handling       *
00338  * (very rudiment)                      *
00339  ****************************************/
00340 
00341 #define MAPPING_GROW_SIZE       512
00342 #define MAX_LINE_LEN            256
00343 
00344 struct user_map_item {
00345         char        *principal; /* NULL means match all */
00346         lnet_nid_t   nid;
00347         uid_t        uid;
00348 };
00349 
00350 struct user_mapping {
00351         int                   nitems;
00352         struct user_map_item *items;
00353 };
00354 
00355 static struct user_mapping mapping = {0, NULL};
00356 /* FIXME to be finished: monitor change of mapping database */
00357 static int mapping_mtime = 0;
00358 
00359 void cleanup_mapping(void)
00360 {
00361         if (mapping.items) {
00362                 for (; mapping.nitems > 0; mapping.nitems--)
00363                         if (mapping.items[mapping.nitems-1].principal)
00364                                 free(mapping.items[mapping.nitems-1].principal);
00365 
00366                 free(mapping.items);
00367                 mapping.items = NULL;
00368         }
00369 }
00370 
00371 static int grow_mapping(int nitems)
00372 {
00373         struct user_map_item *new;
00374         int oldsize, newsize;
00375 
00376         oldsize = (mapping.nitems * sizeof(struct user_map_item) +
00377                    MAPPING_GROW_SIZE - 1) / MAPPING_GROW_SIZE;
00378         newsize = (nitems * sizeof(struct user_map_item) +
00379                    MAPPING_GROW_SIZE - 1) / MAPPING_GROW_SIZE;
00380         while (newsize <= oldsize)
00381                 return 0;
00382 
00383         newsize *= MAPPING_GROW_SIZE;
00384         new = malloc(newsize);
00385         if (!new) {
00386                 printerr(0, "can't alloc mapping size %d\n", newsize);
00387                 return -1;
00388         }
00389 
00390         if (mapping.items) {
00391                 memcpy(new, mapping.items,
00392                        mapping.nitems * sizeof(struct user_map_item));
00393                 free(mapping.items);
00394         }
00395         mapping.items = new;
00396         return 0;
00397 }
00398 
00399 uid_t parse_uid(char *uidstr)
00400 {
00401         struct passwd *pw;
00402         char *p = NULL;
00403         long uid;
00404 
00405         pw = getpwnam(uidstr);
00406         if (pw)
00407                 return pw->pw_uid;
00408 
00409         uid = strtol(uidstr, &p, 0);
00410         if (*p == '\0')
00411                 return (uid_t) uid;
00412 
00413         return -1;
00414 }
00415 
00416 static int read_mapping_db(void)
00417 {
00418         char princ[MAX_LINE_LEN];
00419         char nid_str[MAX_LINE_LEN];
00420         char dest[MAX_LINE_LEN];
00421         char linebuf[MAX_LINE_LEN];
00422         char *line;
00423         lnet_nid_t nid;
00424         uid_t dest_uid;
00425         FILE *f;
00426 
00427         /* cleanup old mappings */
00428         cleanup_mapping();
00429 
00430         f = fopen(MAPPING_DATABASE_FILE, "r");
00431         if (!f) {
00432                 printerr(0, "can't open mapping database: %s\n",
00433                          MAPPING_DATABASE_FILE);
00434                 return -1;
00435         }
00436 
00437         while ((line = fgets(linebuf, MAX_LINE_LEN, f)) != NULL) {
00438                 char *name;
00439 
00440                 if (sscanf(line, "%s %s %s", princ, nid_str, dest) != 3) {
00441                         printerr(0, "mapping db: syntax error\n");
00442                         continue;
00443                 }
00444 
00445                 if (!strcmp(princ, "*")) {
00446                         name = NULL;
00447                 } else {
00448                         name = strdup(princ);
00449                         if (!name) {
00450                                 printerr(0, "fail to dup str %s\n", princ);
00451                                 continue;
00452                         }
00453                 }
00454 
00455                 if (!strcmp(nid_str, "*")) {
00456                         nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00457                 } else {
00458                         nid = libcfs_str2nid(nid_str);
00459                         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00460                                 printerr(0, "fail to parse nid %s\n", nid_str);
00461                                 if (name)
00462                                 free(name);
00463                                 continue;
00464                         }
00465                 }
00466 
00467                 dest_uid = parse_uid(dest);
00468                 if (dest_uid == -1) {
00469                         printerr(0, "no valid user: %s\n", dest);
00470                         if (name)
00471                         free(name);
00472                         continue;
00473                 }
00474 
00475                 if (grow_mapping(mapping.nitems + 1)) {
00476                         printerr(0, "fail to grow mapping to %d\n",
00477                                  mapping.nitems + 1);
00478                         if (name)
00479                         free(name);
00480                         fclose(f);
00481                         return -1;
00482                 }
00483 
00484                 mapping.items[mapping.nitems].principal = name;
00485                 mapping.items[mapping.nitems].nid = nid;
00486                 mapping.items[mapping.nitems].uid = dest_uid;
00487                 mapping.nitems++;
00488                 printerr(1, "add mapping: %s(%s/0x%llx) ==> %d\n",
00489                          name, nid_str, nid, dest_uid);
00490         }
00491 
00492         fclose(f);
00493         return 0;
00494 }
00495 
00496 static inline int mapping_changed(void)
00497 {
00498         struct stat st;
00499 
00500         if (stat(MAPPING_DATABASE_FILE, &st) == -1) {
00501                 /* stat failed, treat it like doesn't exist or be removed */
00502                 if (mapping_mtime == 0) {
00503                         return 0;
00504                 } else {
00505                         printerr(0, "Warning: stat %s failed: %s\n",
00506                                  MAPPING_DATABASE_FILE, strerror(errno));
00507 
00508                         mapping_mtime = 0;
00509                         return 1;
00510                 }
00511         }
00512 
00513         if (st.st_mtime != mapping_mtime) {
00514                 mapping_mtime = st.st_mtime;
00515                 return 1;
00516         }
00517 
00518         return 0;
00519 }
00520 
00521 int lookup_mapping(char *princ, lnet_nid_t nid, uid_t *uid)
00522 {
00523         int n;
00524 
00525         *uid = -1;
00526 
00527         /* FIXME race condition here */
00528         if (mapping_changed()) {
00529                 if (read_mapping_db())
00530                         printerr(0, "all remote users will be denied\n");
00531         }
00532 
00533         for (n = 0; n < mapping.nitems; n++) {
00534                 struct user_map_item *entry = &mapping.items[n];
00535 
00536                 if (entry->nid != LNET_NID_ANY && entry->nid != nid)
00537                         continue;
00538                 if (!entry->principal || !strcasecmp(entry->principal, princ)) {
00539                         printerr(1, "found mapping: %s ==> %d\n",
00540                                  princ, entry->uid);
00541                         *uid = entry->uid;
00542                         return 0;
00543                 }
00544         }
00545 
00546         printerr(2, "no mapping for %s/%#Lx\n", princ, nid);
00547         return -1;
00548 }
